{"metadata":{"objective":"Identifying arguments","lastStepAudioPath":""},"steps":[{"headerText":"Your sister needs advice","leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"><strong>You are</strong></span> mediating a family disagreement between your sister and her sons (your nephews) about how much they use their phones.&nbsp; In order to give her your best advice, you need to understand all sides of the issue.<br /><br /><strong><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">Your first step</span></strong> is to make sure that you understand what an argument is, and then identify your sister&#39;s argument.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"><strong>Try it!</strong></span><br /><br /><span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\"><span style=\"color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial; white-space: pre-wrap;\">Note for screen readers: Press Alt + 1 , or option + 1 on Mac, to open the try it information box in a new window and access information needed to answer some of the questions. In the content, this needed information is described as being in the box or table to the right.</span></span></p>","rightText":"<table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><strong>Turn off the phone!</strong></p><p>Your sister wants to implement a rule that each person in the family can spend no more than two hours per day on a phone.&nbsp; She believes that setting this limit will give the family more time to spend together.<br /><br />Your teenage nephews do not agree with this idea at all. They believe that they should have unlimited access to their electronic devices, including their phones<span style=\"color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 18.4px; orphans: auto; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 1; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);\">.</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","settings":{"showHeader":1,"showAudio":1,"audioPath":"","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0","showRFB":0}},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Sometimes we use the word <strong>argument</strong> to refer to a spirited discussion or a heated exchange of words.&nbsp; In a formal or academic context, <strong>argument</strong><em>&nbsp;</em>means a position that someone takes or a claim that someone makes.&nbsp; An argument can be made either in speech or in writing.</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"What is an argument?  Identifying the claim"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>An argument consists of a <strong>claim</strong> or a <strong>position</strong>.&nbsp; A strong argument includes a <strong>reason</strong> that supports or justifies the claim or position.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"There are three stages of an argument: the argument, the rebuttal, and the counter-rebuttal.   In the argument stage, your sister makes her argument.  In the rebuttal stage, your nephews attack the argument. In the counter-rebuttal stage, your sister attacks the rebuttal and supports the argument.  This mini-lesson is about the argument stage in which your sister makes her argument.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"rightText":null,"leftText":"<p>In an argument, there are two common ways to state the <strong>claim </strong>or<strong> position</strong>:<br />&nbsp;</p><ol><li><strong>Characterization:</strong> A statement that something is good or is bad.&nbsp; A characterization can be positive or negative.<br />&nbsp;</li><li><strong>Proposal:</strong><em> </em>A statement that someone should do something or that something should occur.</li></ol>","headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Which of these sentences states a claim in the form of a characterization or a proposal?<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_eaf15a25-72bd-97b2-1385-23a42e12e98e\" style=\"width: 200px;
